author: travelandtourworld.com
title: MelbourneTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Visit Tahbilk’s Cellar Door over Melbourne Cup long weekend Published on : Saturday, October 24, 2015
Visit Tahbilk’s Cellar Door over the Melbourne Cup long weekend to taste the Tahbilk 2010 ‘1860 Vines’ Shiraz.
This release is noteworthy, as it represents 150 years of Shiraz at Tahbilk! The vines were planted in 1860, these vines are some of the oldest original Shiraz vines left in the world.
The wine itself is one of distinction, in fact at a complete vertical tasting of each 1860 Vines Shiraz from the inaugural 1979 through to the latest 2010 James Haliday (Wine Companion) nominated the 2010 release as the best vintage across them all!
Opportunities to taste wines of this calibre are rare indeed.
Tastings will be redeemable against purchases on the day of $30 or more, so quite likely you will taste the 2010 ‘1860 Vines’ Shiraz for free and no pre-purchase of tickets needed, just turn up to cellar door on the day (Oct 31).
